I have a constructive critique which comes from a place of love and appreciation for all that you've done. Please have someone else be the voice of Khan Academy. I've tried on numerous occasions to use your videos and the content is amazing, as is the method of instruction, but a re-dub would make me use the content. I think tone and delivery are just as imperative to the educational experience as is what is said, and what is seen, or being manipulated, while listening. Not that I actually think my voice is that much better but I would be willing to go back over and re-dub them all to take out instances of repetition and use a tone which more engaging to the ear.

Law school enrollment has dropped meaning lost revenue for LSAC, which administers the LSAT. This is a desperate move by LSAC to try and encourage more people to enroll in law schools which are also desperate. Sal, with all due respect, don't enable the long con known as law school by providing this service. Khan Academy is great and I have benefited greatly but this LSAT prep will only encourage people to take the rip off LSAT to get into rip off law school, leaving a majority at the end with no job or a low paying job at the end of it all with 100s of thousands of dollars in unpaid loans. I hope you reconsider this partnership.
